item.title: Accessing protected content via GET requests
item.dc:creator: Marco Hassan
item.description:
Sometimes when I want to make notes I prefer to download an html file, transform it to an .org file via pandoc and to edit and make notes in org mode.

Nonetheless if the technique works fine for non-protected HTML pages, sometimes you are required to pass some authorization variables to access a page. This post outline my solution to deal with the latter case.

item.title: Useful Network debugging Tools
item.dc:creator: Marco Hassan
item.description:
There are many handy tools you can leverage when debugging your network. This is a brief list with possible commands to keep the performance of your network under track and to identify the piece of the network it is failing; i.e. whether it is a DNS, WebServer, DHCP error or whatever.

It moreover illustrates handy tools through which you can gain a better understanding of internet protocols as you are able to open individuals packages and frames at the different layers and observe their payloads and headers.

item.title: Shell Scripts and Interactive Shell
item.dc:creator: Marco Hassan
item.description:
Today I came accross a nice way to write and append information to a document. This is particularly useful when making tutorial and writing instructions for folks that do work with emacs or any proper text editor.

Instead of working with nano you can simply write multiple lines directly in your shell leveraging the << delimiter condition and passing the input to a document of interest.

item.title: Nice Web 2.0 Formatted Technical Documents
item.dc:creator: Marco Hassan
item.description:
The other day I randomly came across this nice youtube video. It was a suggestion of youtube, so probably it is starting to get to know me too well.

In any case the guy wrote a very nice CSS styleguide for technical documentation that you can use when creating some technical documentation.

You can then simply code in orgmode and by specifying the location of the guy CSS style when exporting your org mode document into html it will be nicely rendered and you will have then the opportunity to nicely write your technical documentation.
